name: RenderElement
description: The RenderElement is the base interface for all 2D rendering components in JsMacros. It defines the fundamental functionality for rendering visual elements on the screen, providing a standardized framework for 2D graphics such as text, images, rectangles, lines, and other UI components. This interface is implemented by various rendering components that can be added to a Draw2D context for screen-space visualization.
overview:
The RenderElement interface serves as the foundation for 2D rendering in JsMacros, providing:

- Standardized rendering method that integrates with Minecraft's GUI rendering system
- Z-index support for controlling element rendering order
- Matrix transformation utilities for positioning, scaling, and rotation
- Integration with the Draw2D rendering system for screen-space visualization
- Compatibility with Minecraft's Drawable interface for seamless integration

methods.name: getZIndex
methods.description: Returns the Z-index of the element to determine rendering order. Elements with higher Z-indices are rendered on top of elements with lower Z-indices.

methods.name: render
methods.signature: void render(DrawContext drawContext, int mouseX, int mouseY, float tickDelta)
methods.description: Renders the element to the screen. This method is called every frame by the Draw2D context.

parameters.name: tickDelta
parameters.description: The time delta between ticks for interpolation

methods.name: setupMatrix
methods.signature: void setupMatrix(MatrixStack matrices, double x, double y, double scale, double rotation)
methods.description: A utility method to handle common matrix transformations including translation, scaling, and rotation.
examples:
// Simple positioning and scaling
this.setupMatrix(matrices, x, y, scale, rotation);

// Position at (100, 50), 2x larger, rotated 30 degrees
this.setupMatrix(matrices, 100, 50, 2.0, 30);

methods.name: setupMatrix
methods.signature: void setupMatrix(MatrixStack matrices, double x, double y, double scale, double rotation, double width, double height, boolean centerRotation)
methods.description: A utility method to handle matrix transformations with support for rotating around the element's center point.

parameters.name: width
parameters.description: The width of the element (for center calculation)

parameters.name: height
parameters.description: The height of the element (for center calculation)

parameters.name: centerRotation
parameters.description: Whether to rotate around the center of the element

examples:
// Rotate around element center
this.setupMatrix(matrices, x, y, scale, rotation, width, height, true);

// 100x50 rectangle rotated around its center
this.setupMatrix(matrices, 200, 150, 1.0, 45, 100, 50, true);
